result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen Wayne Aslakson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephen Wayne Aslakson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stephen Wayne Aslakson was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#3 in 15CF239

miscConds.notes: $500 cash bond applied to court costs.

Provide DNA sample.
Agent to have the authority to order any assessments deemed necessary after viewing the compass evaluation and to take a strong look at an AODA.

supervisions.notes:
Parties stipulated Defendant is entitled to 140 days credit. Release date December 5, 2016.
Concurrent with: 15CF239

10:33  This includes 15CF239, 15CF240, 16CF67.  Defendant Stephen Wayne Aslakson in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Defendant Stephen Wayne Aslakson in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie - Requests 8 mo jail on 15CF127.    Time served on  15CF239.   140 Days credit.   Atty Harrelson agrues jail sentence time He states 147 days credit.    Court will decide days of credit after reviewing the information provided by Atty Harrelson.  Harrelson supports the DOC recomendation of 8 mo on 15CF127 and 3 mo on 15CF239  with huber. Court orders 15CF127 8 mo jail and 15CF239 time served conc to each other. Huber will be allowed.  Court will review the case law and make a decision on time served .  The dates of 4-12-16 to 6-27-16 are what is in question. Set for a status conf in 30 days.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
filed by Probation and Parole Agent Charysse Minder

records.addlTxt:
11:08 Defendant Stephen Wayne Aslakson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF85, 15CF239, 15CT29, 15CT38, 15CT52, 15CT73, 15CT156 and 15tR704-707. Thorie files an amended criminal complaint on 15CT73. Thorie: guilty to Ct#2 15CF127, guilty to Ct#1 in amended criminal complaint 15CT73, guilty to Ct#3 in 15CF239.  2 years probation on Ct#2 in 15CF127 and Ct#3 in 15CF239; concurrent. court costs. All remaining cases and counts will be dismissed.  Nelson and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 of the amended criminal complaint of 15CT73, guilty to Ct#2 in 15CF127 and guilty to Ct#3 in 15CF239; Nelson stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1 contained in the amended complaint in 15CT73, Ct#2 in 15CF127 and Ct#3  in 15CF239. 
Dismiss: 15TR704-707
Ct#1, 3,4 15CF127
Ct#1,2,4,5,6 15CF239, Ct#2 15CT73
15CT156, 15CT52, 15CF85, 15CT29, 15CT38
Thorie and Nelson address sentencing. Court: S/W 2 years probation Ct#2 in 15CF127 and Ct#3 in 15CF239; concurrent to each other. conditions: court costs, DNA surcharge and DNA sample. Agent to have the authority to order any assessments necessary after viewing the compass evaluation and take a strong look at an AODA.

Court orders; Ct#1 15CT73: 20 days jail; stayed until on or before March 18, 2016 at 7pm. Huber allowed after 1st 48 hours. 14 months revocation, $ 1505.00 fine---1 year to pay,  IID for a period of 1 yr to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.  IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY. AODA and Driver Safety Plan; comply. $50 IID surcharge.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

Information is filed with the court.   Defendant has copy of information . Reading waived.  Def pleads not guilty to Ct 1,2,3,4. Set for PTC  Bond conditions are reviewed with the defendant. Defendant Stephen Wayne Aslakson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  15CF85, 15CT29, 15CT38 DA withdraws the warrant authoriztion on these cases.
